text: Zhao Xi (4-80 AD) was a politician in the early Eastern Han Dynasty. He was born in Wan, Nanyang Commandery and was known for his honor. At the age of 15, he lost his older cousin and decided to avenge him. The killer was sick, so Zhao spared him. But after recovering, Zhao killed him. He served with Gengshi, Guangwu, and Ming. Zhao died as a result of an illness in 80 AD. ==References== * Fan Ye. Book of the Later Han, Volume 26, Biography of Zhao Xi.
